title: Kyrie Irving could lose $15 million as Nets won't let him play until he's vaccinated
text:
https://twitter.com/malika_andrews/status/1447940549693091841Irving hasn't been able to participate in Nets practices and preseason home games so far this year due to local requirements in New York City for unvaccinated people.

These vaccine restrictions are from the local officials, and not from the NBA.

See also: ‘I quit,' a record number of U.S. workers are telling their bosses

Irving was scheduled to make $35.2 million this season from the Nets, and the Nets say he will still be paid for road games that he is technically eligible to play in.

If Irving does not get vaccinated the entire NBA season, he would lose roughly $15 million from the Nets, according to ESPN's Bobby Marks.

Irving could also be in danger of losing some money he earns from his Nike NKE sponsorship deal.

Brands like Nike and Adidas XE:ADS routinely include reduction clauses in their contracts with athletes that protect them if the athlete misses significant time from their sport or retires — Irving earns approximately $11 million annually from the Nike, according to Forbes.
